# Complete Coyote Restomod Guide for 1967-1969 Ford Mustang

The Ford Coyote 5.0L engine swap represents one of the most transformative modifications for classic Mustangs, combining vintage aesthetics with modern performance. [![Mustang Coyote Engine Swap Parts | CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/mustang-coyote-engine-swap-parts/c/5822/) [![Swapping A Coyote Engine Into Your Older Mustang Has Never Been Easier - Holley Motor Life](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.holley.com/blog/post/swapping_a_coyote_engine_into_your_older_mustang_has_never_been_easier/) This swap delivers 412-460+ horsepower [![Holley](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&) while actually reducing weight by 50-80 pounds compared to original iron-block engines. [![Coyote V8 Swap Tips: 2011-2014 F-150 vs Mustang Gen 1 5.0s - Ford-Trucks.com](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.ford-trucks.com/articles/coyote-v8-swap-tips-2011-2014-f-150-vs-mustang-gen-1-5-0s/) [![Mustang Tremec TKX Transmission Swap Guide - LMR.com](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://lmr.com/products/ford-mustang-tremec-tkx-5-speed-transmission-swap-guide) Real-world builds achieve quarter-mile times of 11.3-11.6 seconds at 121+ mph, [![My New Coyote Swap Numbers | Ford Mustang Forums](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.corral.net/threads/my-new-coyote-swap-numbers.1418816/) with near 50/50 weight distribution when properly executed.

## Engine Swap Component Inventory

### Motor Mount Solutions

The Coyote's 27.5-inch width requires careful mounting strategy. [![TCCoA Forums](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&) **Ford Performance's M-6038-M50 kit** ($800-1,200) provides the official solution, [![Mustang 2011-2017 5.0L Coyote Motor Mount Kit | Accessories | Ford.com](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.ford.com/product/50l-coyote-engine-mount-kit-p2796742407) while aftermarket options offer more flexibility. **Hooker Blackheart's system** maintains consistent engine positioning across different K-member brands, critical for header fitment. [![Swapping A Coyote Engine Into Your Older Mustang Has Never Been Easier - Holley Motor Life](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.holley.com/blog/post/swapping_a_coyote_engine_into_your_older_mustang_has_never_been_easier/) For complete front-end conversions, **Total Control Products TCP-KCFA22** ($3,000-4,000) eliminates shock towers entirely with an integrated firewall-length frame.

Budget builders can use **AJE's Colt 65 K-member** ($1,000-1,500) with trimmed shock towers, though this limits future suspension upgrades and header choices.

### Oil Pan Requirements

Front sump configurations work best for classic Mustang chassis. [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/) [![1967 Mustang Is the Perfect Blueprint for a Coyote Swap](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.hotrod.com/features/1967-ford-mustang-coyote-v8-swap) **Canton Racing's 15-736 front sump T-pan** ($400-500) offers 7-quart capacity with diamond-shaped baffling, fitting 1965-1973 Mustangs with aftermarket K-members. [![Canton Racing Products 15-738 Mustang Oil Pan Front Sump T-Pan 5.0L Coyote Swap 1965-1973](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/canton-racing-products-oil-pan-front-sump-t-pan-5-0l-coyote-swap-1965-1973/p/OP55/) For better ground clearance, Canton's **TD-15-736 rear sump** ($450-550) provides 9.5-quart capacity but requires careful crossmember selection. [![Rear Sump Oil Pan Kit and Pick-up for 5.0 Gen 3 Coyote Engine Swap](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.stang-aholics.com/i-31643311-rear-sump-oil-pan-kit-and-pick-up-for-5-0-gen-3-coyote-engine-swap.html)

### Headers and Exhaust Systems

Header selection depends entirely on suspension choice. [![1967 Mustang Is the Perfect Blueprint for a Coyote Swap](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.hotrod.com/features/1967-ford-mustang-coyote-v8-swap) [![Swapping A Coyote Engine Into Your Older Mustang Has Never Been Easier - Holley Motor Life](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.holley.com/blog/post/swapping_a_coyote_engine_into_your_older_mustang_has_never_been_easier/) **Hooker Blackheart long tubes** ($800-1,200) feature 1-3/4" primaries with 3" collectors in 304 stainless steel, compatible with multiple K-member manufacturers. [![Hooker BlackHeart Releases 1996-2004 Mustang Coyote Swap Long Tube Headers - Holley Motor Life](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.holley.com/blog/post/hooker_blackheart_releases_1996-2004_mustang_coyote_swap_long_tube_headers/) **Doug's Headers** ($600-900) specifically fit Mustang II suspension conversions. [![Doug's Long Tube Headers Black Hi-Temp Coated For Mustang II Suspension 5.0L Coyote Swap 1965-1973](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/doug-s-long-tube-headers-black-hi-temp-coated-for-mustang-ii-suspension-5-0l-coyote-swap-1965-1973/p/EXHD71/) [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/) Budget builds can use Hooker's shorty headers ($400-600) but sacrifice 10-15 horsepower.

### Cooling System Upgrades

Electric fans are mandatory - mechanical fans won't clear. [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/) **C&R Racing's Coyote-specific radiator** ($1,200-1,500) includes dual 11" Spal fans producing 2,900 CFM, integrated oil and power steering coolers, and direct bolt-in fitment. [![67 - 70 Mustang Aluminum Radiator Kit, with Dual Fans, 5.0 Coyote Engine Swap](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.stang-aholics.com/i-24721568-67-70-mustang-aluminum-radiator-kit-with-dual-fans-5-0-coyote-engine-swap.html) [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/) **Mishimoto's complete package** ($800-1,000) offers similar performance at lower cost. [![Ford Mustang (289/302) Cooling Package, 1967-1969 | Mishimoto](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.mishimoto.com/ford-mustang-cooling-package-67-69.html) Budget options like Champion's 2-row aluminum radiator ($400-600) require separate fan purchases.

### Fuel System Components

High-pressure EFI requires complete fuel system replacement. [![How Much Does A Coyote Swap Cost? | Price Breakdown](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://lmr.com/products/How-Much-Does-A-Coyote-Swap-Cost) [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/) **Revology's aluminum EFI tank** ($1,500-2,000) features 17-gallon capacity with internal baffles and 200-340 LPH pump options. [![Fuel Your 65-70 Mustang Coyote Swap Project with Revology Performance’s Bolt-In EFI Fuel Tank](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://shop.revologycars.com/blogs/restomod-blog/fuel-your-65-70-mustang-coyote-swap-project-with-revology-performance-s-bolt-in-efi-fuel-tank) **Tanks Inc/Holley Sniper systems** ($800-1,200) offer 16-22 gallon capacities with multiple pump configurations. [![1969-70 Ford Mustang EFI Fuel Tank System | Tanks Inc TF28H-T | Sniper EFI 19-117 Mercury Cougar](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.efisystempro.com/sniper-efi-fuel-tank-system-69-70-ford-mustang-19-117) [![EFI Fuel Tank System, 1964-68 Mustang, 1967-68 Cougar](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.efisystempro.com/sniper-efi-fuel-tank-system-64-68-mustang-19-102) All Coyote applications require 55-58 PSI fuel pressure and return-style systems for Ford Control Packs. [![psi coyote swap | Vintage Mustang Forums](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.vintage-mustang.com/threads/psi-coyote-swap.1186328/)

### Engine Control Solutions

**Ford Performance Control Packs** remain the gold standard:
- Gen 1 (2011-2014): M-6017-A504VA ($2,000-2,400) [![CONTROL PACK - 2015-17 COYOTE 5.0L MANUAL TRANSMISSION| Part Details for M-6017-504V | Ford Performance Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://performanceparts.ford.com/part/M-6017-504V)
- Gen 2 (2015-2017): M-6017-504V ($2,100-2,500) [![CONTROL PACK 2015-2017 COYOTE 5.0L WITH AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION| Part Details for M-6017-M50A | Ford Performance Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://performanceparts.ford.com/part/M-6017-M50A)  
- Gen 3 (2018-2023): M-6017-A504VD ($2,200-2,600) [![Ford](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)

These include complete wiring harnesses, PCM, drive-by-wire pedal assembly, and proven calibrations. [![MotorTrend](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D) Aftermarket alternatives like AEM Infinity ($3,000-4,000) offer more tuning flexibility but require extensive knowledge. [![AEM Infinity Series 7 Plug and Play Adapter Harness for Ford Coyote Engines using Ford Racing Control Pack - Brewed Motorsports](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.brewedmotorsports.com/product/electronics/ecu-harnesses-and-sensors/aem-performance-electronics/aem-infinity-series-7-harness-ford-coyote/)

## Transmission Integration Options

### Manual Transmissions

The **Tremec T56 Magnum** handles 700 lb-ft torque with multiple shifter locations. [![Moderndriveline](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&) American Powertrain's APT-T56-KIT-6770 ($4,500-6,000) includes everything needed for 1967-1970 installations. The **Tremec TKX** ($3,500-4,500) offers a more compact package with 600 lb-ft capacity, ideal for tighter budgets and minimal tunnel modifications. [![Mustang Tremec TKX Transmission Swap Guide - LMR.com](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://lmr.com/products/ford-mustang-tremec-tkx-5-speed-transmission-swap-guide) [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/)

### Automatic Transmissions

The **6R80 automatic** requires significant tunnel modifications but provides OEM reliability with excellent gear ratios. [![Tdmotion](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D) Ford's M-6017-M50A control pack manages the transmission electronically. [![JPC- Tremec Magnum XL S197 Conversion Complete Kit - Justin's Performance Center](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.jpcracing.com/jpc-tremec-magnum-xl-s197-conversion-complete-kit/) The newer **10R80** only works with Gen 3 Coyotes [![Coyote Archives - MARS Auto Parts & Engine Swaps LS Swap Parts | Kits | Turnkey Pallets](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://swaptheuniverse.com/product-category/ford/coyote/) and demands even more tunnel clearance - recommended only for high-performance builds. [![Gen 3 Coyote Control Pack Kit 2021-2023 - Automatic Transmission 10R80 – Pro Touring Store](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://protouringstore.com/products/gen-3-coyote-control-pack-kit-2021-2023-automatic-transmission-10r80-m-6017-m50baa) [![Gen 3 Coyote w/ 10R80 — Gateway Classic Mustang & Suspension](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.gatewaymustang.com/crate-engines/complete-modern-powertrain)

### Driveshaft and Supporting Components

Custom driveshafts are typically required due to length variations. Use 1350-series U-joints for high-torque applications. **Stifflers' STF-TCB6R80KIT crossmember** ($300-400) provides adjustable mounting for various transmission options. [![Stifflers Mustang Tubular Transmission Crossmember - 6R80 10R80 Coyote 5.0 Swap](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://buystifflers.com/transmission-crossmember-kit-for-6r80-/-10r80-/-mt82/) [![Stifflers Mustang Tubular Transmission Crossmember - 10R80/6R80/MT-82 (79-04) TCB-6R80 KIT](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://lmr.com/item/STF-TCB6R80KIT/mustang-tubular-transmission-crossmember-stifflers-6r80)

## Suspension System Upgrades

### Front Suspension Transformation

**Detroit Speed's Aluma-Frame** ($8,500+) represents the premium solution, completely eliminating shock towers with 6 inches of suspension travel. [![Detroit Speed Aluma-Frame Front Suspension System - Base Shocks 032050DS - Detroit Speed](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.detroitspeed.com/products/suspension_and_chassis/subframe_assemblies/aluma-frame/parts/032050DS) **Ridetech's HQ Series with StrongArms** ($2,800-3,500) offers excellent handling improvement while retaining stock mounting points. [![Ridetech Mustang Coilover Suspension Kit With Strong Arms HQ Series Front 1967-1970](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/ridetech-coilover-suspension-kit-with-strong-arms-hq-series-front-1967-1970/p/SUSK63/) Budget builds can use **QA1 coilovers** ($1,200-2,000) with factory spring pockets, though this limits adjustability.

Spring rates for Coyote engines typically require 400-450 lb/in front springs versus 275-350 lb/in for small-block Fords. [![Detroit Speed Aluma-Frame Front Suspension System - Base Shocks 032050DS - Detroit Speed](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.detroitspeed.com/products/suspension_and_chassis/subframe_assemblies/aluma-frame/parts/032050DS)

### Rear Suspension Options

**4-link systems** from TCI ($2,500-3,200) or Heidts ($2,800-3,800) provide modern handling with bolt-in installation and minimal welding. **Detroit Speed's Quadralink** ($3,500-4,500) offers premium construction with proven geometry. Consider **3-link alternatives** from Street or Track ($3,600+) for superior anti-squat characteristics.

Mini-tubs add 2.5 inches of tire clearance for $1,200-1,500, often required for 315+ width rear tires.

## Brake System Requirements

### Disc Brake Conversions

**Wilwood's Dynalite 4-piston kit** (140-13476, $800-1,200) fits 14-inch wheels with 11.3-inch vented rotors. [![Wilwood 140-13476 Mustang Front Disc Brake Kit Dynalite 4-Piston 11.3" V8 Spindles 1965-1966/1967-1969](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/wilwood-front-disc-brake-kit-dynalite-4-piston-11-3-mustang-v8-spindles-1965-1966-all-1967-1969/p/DBF200-V/) For serious performance, **Baer's Pro-Plus kit** ($2,200-2,800) features 14-inch rotors with 6-piston calipers but requires 18-inch wheels. [![Mustang Baer Brakes Front Disc Brake Kit 14" Pro-Plus 1965-1969 | CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/baer-brakes-front-disc-brake-kit-14-pro-plus-1965-1969/p/DBF105-V/)

### Master Cylinder Solutions

**Hydroboost systems** ($800-1,200) work best with Coyotes, eliminating vacuum requirements while providing excellent pedal feel. [![Ford Mustang Forum](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&) Use 1996-2004 Mustang units with appropriate master cylinder bore sizing.

## Electrical System Integration

### Alternator Upgrades

**Powermaster's 41625** ($400-500) provides 245-amp output specifically for 2011-2017 Coyotes. **JS Alternators' 240-amp racing unit** ($450-550) offers maximum output with hairpin technology for better efficiency.

### Complete Wiring Solutions

**American Autowire's Classic Update Series** ($800-1,200) provides complete vehicle wiring with EFI compatibility. Their 510055 kit (1967-1968) includes ATC fuse panel and supports modern accessories. [![American Autowire Complete Wiring Harness Classic Update Kit Mustang 1967-1968](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/american-autowire-complete-wiring-harness-classic-update-kit-1967-1968/p/WHC6768/) [![American Autowire Complete Wiring Harness Classic Update Kit Mustang 1969](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/american-autowire-complete-wiring-harness-classic-update-kit-1969/p/WHC69/) **Dakota Digital's VHX series** ($1,200-1,500) replaces factory gauges with customizable digital displays maintaining stock appearance. [![1967- 68 Ford Mustang VHX Instruments](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.dakotadigital.com/index.cfm/page/ptype=product/product_id=804/mode=prod/prd804.htm) [![1969- 70 Ford Mustang VHX Instruments](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.dakotadigital.com/index.cfm/page/ptype=product/product_id=791/mode=prod/prd791.htm)

### Battery Relocation

**UPR's NHRA-legal kit** ($300-400) includes aluminum battery box with proper venting and 16 feet of 2-gauge cable. [![Mustang Battery Relocation Kit With Aluminum Battery Box | CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/battery-relocation-kit-with-aluminum-battery-box-1965-2009/p/BRK4/) Run separate fused circuits for alternator (150-amp) and starter connections for safety.

## Supporting Modifications

### Rear Axle Upgrades

**Explorer 8.8-inch axles** (1995-2001) measure 59.5 inches wide, closely matching stock 67-69 width. These provide 31-spline axles, disc brakes, and common gear ratios (3.55-4.10) for $300-600 used. **Strange Engineering's S-Series 9-inch** ($1,200-1,500) offers bulletproof strength with custom widths. [![How to Build a New 9-inch Ford Axle](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.motortrend.com/how-to/1409-how-to-build-a-new-9-inch-ford-axle) [![Ford 9" Bolt-In Rear End With Leaf Spring Mounts | Series Iron Center Section With Differential | Includes Housing & Alloy Axle Package - Strange Engineering](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.strangeengineering.net/product/complete-ford-9-rear-end-assembly-nb.html/)

Recommended gear ratios:
- Street/daily: 3.55-3.73 with overdrive
- Street/strip: 3.73-4.10  
- Drag racing: 4.10-4.30+

### Chassis Reinforcement

**Subframe connectors** are mandatory for Coyote torque. **Global West's 911 kit** ($200-300) uses 1.625-inch DOM tubing welded to torque boxes. [![Subframe Connectors (Non Convertible) Part Number: 911 - Global West Suspension Car Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.globalwest.net/product/mustang-subframe-connectors-non-convertible-1967-1968-1969-1970-1971-1972-1973-global-west-suspensio/) [![Global West 911 Mustang Sub Frame Connector Weld-in Pair 1967-1973 Coupe/Fastback](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/global-west-subframe-connector-pair-coupe-fastback-1967-1973/p/SFC12/?year=1970) Add Monte Carlo bars and export braces for maximum stiffness in high-performance applications.

## Build Process and Timeline

### Critical Measurements Before Starting

Shock tower clearance represents the primary challenge. [![Coyote Engine Swap | RRS USA](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.rrs-usa.com/coyote-engine-swap) Stock towers measure 40 inches center-to-center, while the Coyote requires 27.5 inches minimum width. Most builds require tower removal or significant notching. [![CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)

### Phased Approach

**Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2):** Planning and measurement  
**Phase 2 (Weeks 3-6):** Chassis preparation and suspension installation  
**Phase 3 (Week 7):** Engine mock-up and clearance verification  
**Phase 4 (Weeks 8-12):** Final assembly and systems integration

Professional shops complete swaps in 4-6 weeks, while experienced DIY builders require 6-12 months working weekends. First-time builders should expect 12-24 months including the learning curve.

## Common Problems and Solutions

### Firewall Clearance
Master cylinders require 1.75-inch outboard relocation. [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/) Hydroboost systems solve most clearance issues while improving brake performance. [![CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)

### Header Fitment
Each suspension system requires specific headers. Doug's D6652-SS works with TCI/Heidts systems, while Detroit Speed requires their proprietary designs. [![Coyote Swap Guide - TD Motion Conversion Kits](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://tdmotion.com/coyote-swap-guide/)

### Wiring Integration
Ford Control Packs simplify integration with ~6 power connections required. Drive-by-wire pedal mounting requires custom firewall brackets. [![CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)

## Cost Analysis by Build Level

### Budget Build ($15,000)
- Used Coyote engine: $5,000
- Basic suspension mods: $1,000  
- Headers: $600
- Control Pack: $2,000
- Manual transmission: $3,500
- Supporting systems: $2,900

### Mid-Level Build ($25,000)
- Refurbished Coyote: $8,000
- Quality suspension: $4,000
- Premium cooling: $1,200
- T56 Magnum kit: $6,000
- Complete fuel system: $1,500
- Professional assembly: $4,300

### High-End Build ($35,000+)
- New crate engine: $10,000
- Detroit Speed suspension: $8,000
- Premium accessories: $3,000
- Professional installation: $8,000
- Custom fabrication: $6,000

**Specialized Suppliers:**
- **Detroit Speed**: Complete chassis systems
- **American Powertrain**: Transmission specialists  
- **Canton Racing**: Oil pan solutions
- **Stifflers**: Chassis components

## Performance Expectations

Properly executed swaps achieve:
- 0-60 mph: 4.5-5.5 seconds
- Quarter-mile: 11.3-12.5 seconds  
- Fuel economy: 18-25+ mpg highway
- Weight distribution: Near 50/50 with proper suspension

The transformation combines classic styling with modern performance, creating a vehicle that outperforms new Mustangs while retaining vintage character. [![Mustang Coyote Engine Swap Parts | CJ Pony Parts](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&%3D%3D)](https://www.cjponyparts.com/mustang-coyote-engine-swap-parts/c/5822/) [![Swapping A Coyote Engine Into Your Older Mustang Has Never Been Easier - Holley Motor Life](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=2DE27FD9-BCE9-4A0D-8BCC-A89D0F8759CE&)](https://www.holley.com/blog/post/swapping_a_coyote_engine_into_your_older_mustang_has_never_been_easier/) Success requires careful planning, quality components, and attention to detail throughout the build process.
